articles.content:
Abrogation of "Security Law" urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- At least 600 students under the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) and members of the people's solidarity for the abrogation of the "Security Law" held a rally in Seoul on Feb. 3 in demand of the total abolition of the SL, Seoul-based radio no. 1 said.
 "The bill on revising the 'Security Law' has not been placed on the agenda at the 'national assembly' due to the scramble between political camps," they said, demanding the SL be totally abolished, not revised.    
 Holding that hanchongryon, the national alliance for the country's reunification (Pomminryon) and other organizations that have spearheaded the reunification movement are still branded as "organizations benefiting the enemy", they demanded the withdrawal of this charge.
